name: tau Boo
scenarioDescription:
The tau Boo Exoplanetary System

tau Boo is a star with 1.34 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.46 times its radius. It is located 51.08 light years away from the solar system.

tau Boo is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

tau Boo b

tau Boo b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 1997-01. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.31 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, tau Boo.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.011, which means that when tau Boo b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.05 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.05. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of tau Boo b is 1372.94 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, tau Boo b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system tau Boo, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
